lessons.Learning Objective: Calculate acceleration from the gradient of a speed–time graph

lessons.Learning Objective: Know that a deceleration is a negative acceleration and use this in calculations

lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the motion of objects falling in a uniform gravitational field with and without air/liquid resistance (including reference to terminal velocity)

lessons.Learning Objective: Research the lives and discoveries of scientists who explored the solar system and stars

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Consider how scientists have combined evidence from observation and measurement with creative thinking to suggest new ideas and explanations for phenomena

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Collect evidence and data to test ideas including predictions

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Discuss how to turn ideas into a form that can be tested

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Make predictions using scientific knowledge and understanding

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Choose what evidence to collect to investigate a question; ensuring that the evidence is sufficient

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify factors that are relevant to a particular situation

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Choose which equipment to use

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Make a variety of relevant observations and measurements using simple apparatus correctly

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Decide when observations and measurements need to be checked by repeating to give more reliable data

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use tables; bar charts and line graphs to present results

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Make comparisons

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Evaluate repeated results

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify patterns in results and results that do not appear to fit the pattern

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use results to draw conclusions and to make further predictions

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Suggest and evaluate explanations for predictions using scientific knowledge and understanding and communicate these clearly to others

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Say if and how evidence supports any prediction made

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Use scientific names for some major organs of body systems

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Identify the position of major organs in the body

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Describe the main functions of the major organs of the body

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Explain how the functions of the major organs are essential

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Explore how humans have positive and negative effects on the environment; e.g. loss of species; protection of habitats

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Explore a number of ways of caring for the environment; e.g. recycling; reducing waste; reducing energy consumption; not littering; encouraging others to care for the environment

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know how food chains can be used to represent feeding relationships in a habitat and present these in text and diagrams

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know that food chains begin with a plant (the producer); which uses energy from the sun

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand the terms producer; consumer; predator and prey

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Explore and construct food chains in a particular habitat

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Distinguish between reversible and irreversible changes

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Explore how solids can be mixed and how it is often possible to separate them again

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Observe; describe; record and begin to explain changes that occur when some solids are added to water

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Explore how; when solids do not dissolve or react with water; they can be separated by filtering; which is similar to sieving

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Explore how some solids dissolve in water to form solutions and; although the solid cannot be seen; the substance is still present

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Distinguish between mass measured in kilograms (kg) and weight measured in newtons; noting that kilograms are used in everyday life

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Recognise and use units of force; mass and weight and identify the direction in which forces act

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Understand the notion of energy in movement

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Recognise friction (including air resistance) as a force which can affect the speed at which objects move and which sometimes stops things moving

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Investigate how some materials are better conductors of electricity than others

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Investigate how some metals are good conductors of electricity while most other materials are not

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Know why metals are used for cables and wires and why plastics are used to cover wires and as covers for plugs and switches

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Predict and test the effects of making changes to circuits; including length or thickness of wire and the number and type of components

lessons.Subject: Science
lessons.Learning Objective: Represent series circuits with drawings and conventional symbols
